content.description:
Tricky!

 Stand Start. Climb the inobvious moves on the face of the middle blocks. 

 Thin crimps off the ground lead to a high deadpoint, and then the horizontal crack. Find trustworthy feet for another set of deadpoint moves on more thin crimps before you reach the easier mantle topout.
content.protection: 1 or 2 pads and a decent spotter to keep you from rolling downhill.
content.location: On the face of the larger stacked blocks facing back at the lookout tower. Just left of the distinct middle crack line.

content.description: Tricky moves off of the ground on just ok feet lead to a nice jug at the horizontal crack. a few big moves get you to another good rest and then the lip for an easy mantle top out.
content.protection: 1 or 2 pads and a decent spotter.
content.location: The middle crack line that faces back towards the tower.Â

content.description: Crux is getting off of the ground, but has a few bigger moves high up to good holds that might give some folks pause.
content.protection: A pad or two should do you.
content.location: Left most arete on The Legos.

content.description: Short 1 move wonder uphill from the legos. Stand start in the horizontal seam, bust a big move to get the lip, and then mantle it out.
content.location: Uphill and to the right of the legos.

content.description: Obvious group of stacked blocks ~100 meters west of the lookout tower. A good collection of taller moderates ranging from VB/0 to V4. Generally good landings with an easy walkoff.
